node.title: Auckland bolstered by Blackcaps for long-awaited domestic cricket return
node.description: COVID-19 restrictions in the 'City of Sails' have meant both the Aces and the women's team - the Hearts - have been unable to play.
node.content: ["After having to sit back and watch the domestic cricket season from afar, Auckland Aces are finally ready to return to the field.", "While most other teams have been playing since October, restrictions in the 'City of Sails' have meant both the Aces and the women's team - the Hearts - have been unable to play.", "After weeks of training, and watching other games, the side finally gets to play their first game of the summer - a Twenty20 against the Northern Brave on Friday in Hamilton.", "\"It's been challenging,\" coach Heinrich Malan tells Newshub. \"But I guess that's part of what we've been talking about - being adapatable, being versatile, and they've been really resilient in that space.\u00a0", "\"Just looking forward to getting out there now\u2026 playing some good and consistent cricket and just have some fun.\"", "Adding to the fun is a trio of Blackcaps, with Martin Guptill, Mark Chapman and Lockie Ferguson all available to play for the Aces, while the return of Glenn Phillips, Will Somerville and Kyle Jamieson also looms.", "After a tough few months, captain Robbie O'Donnell's proud of how his side dealt with the adversity and challenges.", "\"It's been a chance for us as a group to one - get to know each other a little bit better and get to understand our games and roles a little bit better, and two -\u00a0 fine tune our skills,\" says O'Donnell.", "Now the time for fine-tuning is - finally - almost over", "Watch the full story above", "\u00a0"]
